intro: Oreodaphne terminalis, commonly known as the hairy-leafed daphne, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
